description: Enel's massive flying ark powered by his lightning and equipped with 200 extinct Jet Dials from Bilka as a backup propulsion system. The ship is designed to reach the Fairy Vearth (the moon).

keyEvents.title: Sanji's Sacrifice and Sabotage
keyEvents.description: Sanji takes Enel's God's Judgment attack on the deck of the Ark Maxim and is revealed to have sabotaged the ship's propulsion systems.
keyEvents.significance: The sabotage temporarily disrupts Enel's plans, though he activates backup systems using extinct Jet Dials from Bilka.

keyEvents.title: Jet Dial Backup System Revealed
keyEvents.description: Enel reveals that the Ark Maxim has backup propulsion powered by 200 extinct Jet Dials from his destroyed homeland of Bilka.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals important information about the ship's advanced technology and Enel's ruthless past.

keyEvents.title: Usopp's Rescue Mission
keyEvents.description: Usopp returns to the Ark Maxim to rescue the unconscious Sanji, successfully escaping with him to safety below.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the courage of the Straw Hats and their willingness to risk their lives for each other.

statusHistory.reason: Operating on backup Jet Dial propulsion after sabotage

description: The sacred land of Skypiea, originally part of Jaya that was knocked into the sky 400 years ago. It is the ancestral homeland of the Shandians and contains the ruins of the Golden City of Shandora.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Reunite
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat crew reunites in the ruins of the Golden City in Upper Yard as Deathpiea begins.
keyEvents.significance: The crew comes together to face the final crisis of the Skypiea Arc.

keyEvents.title: Deathpiea Devastates Upper Yard
keyEvents.description: Enel's Deathpiea attack rains massive lightning strikes across Upper Yard, burning trees and destroying the landscape.
keyEvents.significance: Upper Yard faces complete annihilation as Enel executes his plan to destroy Skypiea.

statusHistory.reason: Enel's Deathpiea attack is actively destroying the island

description: The main residential area of Skypiea where the Sky Island inhabitants live. Home to Conis, Pagaya, and other peaceful Sky People.

keyEvents.title: Deathpiea Strikes Angel Island
keyEvents.description: Enel's devastating lightning strikes begin destroying buildings and infrastructure on Angel Island as part of Deathpiea.
keyEvents.significance: The peaceful home of the Sky People faces complete destruction, forcing mass evacuation.

keyEvents.title: Mass Evacuation of Residents
keyEvents.description: The citizens of Angel Island desperately flee as lightning strikes intensify, with Conis, Pagaya, and others attempting to reach safety.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the human cost of Enel's tyranny and the desperation of the Sky Island inhabitants.

statusHistory.reason: Enel's Deathpiea attack is actively destroying the island

description: A massive beanstalk extending high into the sky above Skypiea, created by Enel's plan. It serves as a path to reach the Ark Maxim at higher altitudes.

keyEvents.title: Nami Rides Up to Help Luffy
keyEvents.description: Nami decides to ride her Waver up the giant beanstalk to help Luffy in his pursuit of Enel.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up Nami's crucial role in the final battle against Enel.

keyEvents.title: Luffy's Pursuit of Enel
keyEvents.description: Luffy races up the massive beanstalk while carrying the giant golden ball, determined to stop Enel.
keyEvents.significance: The beanstalk serves as the path to the final confrontation between Luffy and Enel.

description: The ancient ruins of the Shandian civilization's golden city, located in Upper Yard. Contains the Golden Bell and poneglyph, representing 400 years of history and unfulfilled promises.

keyEvents.title: Crew Reunites in the Ruins
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats reunite in the ruins of Shandora as the crisis reaches its peak.
keyEvents.significance: The ancient city serves as a gathering point for the final act of the Skypiea Arc.
